dcterms:creator: H.P. Grice
dcterms:description: A dataset exploring the interpretation of scalar implicature, where listeners infer meanings beyond the literal words used based on conversational context.
dcterms:title: Scalar Implicature

dcterms:creator: L. Horn
dcterms:description: A dataset focusing on Horn implicature, where listeners infer that a more costly expression implies a rarer meaning.
dcterms:title: Horn Implicature

dcterms:creator: S.C. Levinson
dcterms:description: A dataset examining how children learn literal meanings despite the presence of scalar implicature, focusing on the acquisition of quantifiers.
dcterms:title: Learning Literal Meanings Despite Scalar Implicature

dcterms:creator: E. M. Markman
G. F. Wachtel
dcterms:description: A dataset that investigates how children use mutual exclusivity to disambiguate new words when presented with both novel and familiar objects.
dcterms:title: Disambiguating New Words Using Old Words

dcterms:creator: J. S. Horst
L. K. Samuelson
dcterms:description: A dataset that explores the phenomenon of fast mapping in language learning, highlighting the poor retention of word-object mappings by young children.
dcterms:title: Disambiguation Without Learning

dcterms:creator: B. Galantucci
dcterms:description: A dataset that examines how communicators can establish novel and efficient lexicons through interaction in communication games.
dcterms:title: Emergence of Novel & Efficient Lexicons

dcterms:creator: L. Horn
dcterms:description: A dataset that discusses the lexicalization of Horn implicature, focusing on how implicatures can become part of the literal meaning of words.
dcterms:title: Lexicalization of Horn Implicature
